private_information: I can travel between Chinatown and Russian Hill
Travel time from Chinatown to Russian Hill is 7 minutes
Travel time from Russian Hill to Chinatown is 9 minutes
visitor.goal: Meet as many friends as possible and in particular meet Ronald for a minimum of 105 minutes

private_information: I will be at Russian Hill from 03:15PM to 09:30PM
I can meet the visitor at Russian Hill during my availability window
ronald.goal: Meet the visitor at Russian Hill for at least 105 minutes within my availability window

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate the visitor and Ronald schedules to maximize meetings and ensure Ronald is met for at least 105 minutes

public_information: There are two relevant locations: Chinatown and Russian Hill
Travel time from Chinatown to Russian Hill is 7 minutes
Travel time from Russian Hill to Chinatown is 9 minutes
Ronald will be at Russian Hill from 03:15PM to 09:30PM
You would like to meet Ronald for a minimum of 105 minutes
The goal is to generate and compare different feasible schedules and pick the best one to optimize the meeting goals

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems targeting the FastDownward PDDL solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is visitor. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->visitor->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->visitor->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file formatted for FastDownward that models your possible movements, times, and meeting durations. If you miss some information, do not make assumptions, just provide a plan that concerns the information you have. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems targeting the FastDownward PDDL solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is ronald. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->ronald->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->ronald->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file formatted for FastDownward that models your availability window and possible meeting durations. If you miss some information, do not make assumptions, just provide a plan that concerns the information you have. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems targeting the FastDownward PDDL solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, you must keep their actions distinct.
pddl.prompt: There are two agents in an environment that are planning to solve a task. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. You have to orchestrate them to solve the following task: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Keep in mind that the PDDL they send you may be partial or contain ambiguities. A partial PDDL may partially solve a planning problem but may require integration of additional information from the other PDDL to achieve the goal. Ambiguities may appear in different forms. Here is the information the first agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_visitor} Here is the information the second agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_ronald} You need to integrate the PDDL responses of the two agents to solve the task. It is important that you keep the actions of the two agents distinct. Think step by step and provide a combined multi-agent PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file formatted for FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
